column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: We have implemented several strategies to increase the number of women in senior roles. For each recruitment shortlist, we aim to include at least one female candidate (where we strive to achieve this for 70 per cent of vacancies).

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: Our remuneration policy is firmly committed to achieving pay equality between men and women. Each year, we conduct a thorough analysis of the gender pay gap. If any potential gender bias in performance-related pay is identified, we take immediate corrective measures to rectify such disparities on a like-for-like basis.

column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: Our suppliers must comply with all applicable local, national, and international laws and regulations, including bribery and corruption, modern slavery, and ethical conduct. Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
column7: Our suppliers are expected to provide a fair, ethical, and safe workplace that upholds high human rights standards and integrates appropriate labour and human rights policies and practices into its business. During the year, we asked our strategic and high-risk suppliers to confirm they have policies and processes to Comply with all applicable employment and industrial relations laws and standards relevant to workers' rights and have whistleblowing mechanisms in place to enable people to report matters of concern.

column7: Our next steps include exploring alternate engagement opportunities with our Foundation partners to deepen our understanding of how we can best support the needs of our beneficiaries and other underprivileged groups.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We strongly focus on giving back to the community through the TechnologyOne Foundation, an essential driver of our culture and values. A key focus of our Foundation is supporting underprivileged and at-risk youths by empowering them to transform their lives for success.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We also assembled and/or quality-checked over 900 SolarBuddy lights distributed to disadvantaged children in Fiji, Papua New Guinea, and Sudan living in energy poverty. For International Earth Day, we ran volunteer sessions to build solar kits for children and families living without electricity on remote islands of Indonesia. The 900 lights we assembled impacted approximately 4,500 lives, enabling an additional 2.2 million educational study hours. \t

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: TechnologyOne uses the Net Promoter Score (NPS) to understand customer satisfaction, which measures an individual's tendency to recommend TechnologyOne to others. The NPS serves as a valuable tool for comprehending our customers' sentiments, helping us identify our strengths and areas that require improvement.
column20: Net Promoter Score, Customer Satisfaction, Feedback Analysis

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column7: During the year, we assessed over 230 new suppliers or those with altered supply agreements over $1,000 for modern slavery risk. All our suppliers are expected to identify, prevent, and address modern slavery risks and to hold their supply chains to the same standard.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column7: Our standard supply contract terms include enforceable undertakings against modern slavery and human rights infringements. Suppose we identify adverse human rights impacts (such as modern slavery) that we may have caused or contributed to. In that case, we will seek to address these impacts in line with the guidance provided under the United Nations Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights, including by providing or cooperating in remediation activities.

column6: Political contributions
column7: We will build TechnologyOne's reputation through proactive engagement with government policymakers, officials, and other stakeholders. Laws and regulations in the countries in which TechnologyOne operates govern the offering or giving of anything of value to Public Officials to influence their actions. Transactions with governments are not the same as conducting business with private parties.

column13: Unless a local jurisdiction requires otherwise, we seek to apply General Data Protection Regulation equivalent data privacy requirements to all activities involving collecting, processing, and managing personal data. Our related entities are in Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and Malaysia, where we take commercially reasonable steps to maintain sound governance parameters and controls.
